chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Yohance Tywan Germany was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay the balance of all other court costs, fees, and surcharges. If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections from a percentage of prison funds/wages under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution is set at ZERO.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
- Commit no new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.

filed.

Defendant Yohance Tywan Germany in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.
Credit given for 156 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* Commit no new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  If revoked, the Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from a percentage of prison funds/wages under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
* PAY the balance of all other court costs, fees, and surcharges.  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from a percentage of prison funds/wages under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Restitution is set at ZERO.

Felony firearm and body armor warnings given.
Voting rights warnings given.
Appeal rights given.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court by phone.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cleghorn in trial and unable to appear in court.  Case remains calendared in Br. 18.  Defendant to appear to obtain his next court date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.     Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Yohance Tywan Germany in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Yohance Tywan Germany in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. State's witnesses were picked up on the body attachments. Court cancels warrants for both R.H. and B.H. Jury in the box at 9:23 am. Sidebar discussions placed on the record. Defense requests a mistrial. State object. Due to reasons placed on the record, Court grants defense motion and orders a mistrial. Jury in box at 10:02 am. Court dismissed jurors. Jury out of box at 10:04 am. State withdrew exhibits. State requests a Jury Trial date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 18.  Jury trial scheduled for March 5, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Trial continued. Jury in the box at 1:35 pm. Sworn for the state: Sargent Scott Freiburger. Exhibits 7 through 24 received. Jury out of box at 2:50 pm. Sidebar discussions placed on the record. Case passed. 

Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. State requests additional time to locate witnesses. Defense objects. Court ordered case adjourned to 11/29/2017 at 8:30 am. Jury in box at 4:04 pm. Court instructed jury. Jury out of box at 4:14 pm.

Defendant Yohance Tywan Germany in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Yohance Tywan Germany in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sworn for the State: Sargent William Schmitz and Milwaukee Police Detective Jason Enk. Jury out of box at 11:35 pm. Exhibits 1 through 6 received. Court ordered case passed to 1:30 pm.

Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court, defendant Yohance Tywan Germany not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for Jury Trial.  There was a problem at the facility with the Defendant and he was not produced.  Matter is adjourned for a Jury Trial on June 27, 2016 at 9:00am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
ADA Ringersma and Attorney Tanz agreed to change the jury trial date from February 8, 2016 to February 29, 2016 at 9:00am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Defendant Yohance Tywan Germany in court with Attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Yohance Tywan Germany in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Jury Trial.  Defense motioned for an adjournment due to one of his witnesses who is not available.  The State objected to this motion.  Arguments heard.  The Court DENIED the motion for adjournment.  The Court is currently in trial and requested this trial be heard by another court.  The matter was spun to Judge Stark.  Attorney Tanz filed a Request for Substitution of Judge on Judge Stark, received and filed.  The case was tabbed back to Judge Conen, who is unable to do the case today.  Attorney Tanz informed Defendant of this, and the Defendant insisted on going to trial today and withdrawing his substitution request.  The Court's clerk checked to see if Judge Stark was still available, and she was not.  The Court ordered that the Request for Substitution will stand.  The matter was adjourned for a Jury Trial on February 8, 2016 at 9:00am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
